title: Statistics and Data Analysis

vocab.definition: A graph showing the relationship between two sets of data
A line that best represents the trend in scattered data
A data point that is very different from other data points
The general direction or pattern in data

teachingNotes: Use real data sets to create scatter plots. Discuss how to interpret relationships between variables.

sample.question: What graph shows the relationship between two sets of data?

truefalse.question: An outlier is a data point very different from others.

multiplechoice.question: What represents the trend in scattered data?

fillintheblank.question: A relationship between two variables is called a ________.

shortanswer.question: What does a positive correlation mean?
expectedAny: as one variable increases, the other increases

wordProblems.question: In a scatter plot of height vs shoe size, if most points trend upward from left to right, what type of correlation is this?
